Key Match Events: Denver Nuggets lost 102-87 to the Oklahoma City Thunder in their season opener.
Post-Match Reflections: Nikola Jokić expressed that outside of Michael Porter Jr. and Jamal Murray, the team is not replete with great shooters.
Nuggets coach Michael Malone said that shooting was a concern of his heading into the season but that the team is not worried at such an early juncture.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jokić had a strong day, scoring 16 points on 6-of-13 shooting while also adding 13 rebounds and 12 assists.
Christian Braun played good defense and competed, ran the floor.
Others: The Denver Nuggets' shooting was a major issue in their season opener, going 35-of-98 from the field and just 7-of-38 from three-point range.
